posts.title: Templates, Drag/Drop, and Hotkeys
posts.contents:
It’s only been a week since our last post, but we’ve added a few big features, so here’s a quick update:

Templates

This feature, based on the Board Folders feature from the last update, lets you save a Board Folder as a template which you can share publicly. The boards inside that folder and all the documents contained within them will be copied into a template and you’ll be given a URL that you can share to use that template.

If you’d like, you can embed these templates in blog posts describing your workflow, or you can simply share the template itself. In the future we’ll add a way to install templates into your account as well as view/install counting to create a dashboard of the most popular templates. For now, please let us know what else you’d like to see out of this Templates feature.

Note: Templates are a copy of all of the documents in those boards that does not stay in sync. You can update the template by saving it again.

Multiselect drag/drop

This has been requested for a long time, and we’re very excited to have finally released it! You can now highlight multiple items and drag/drop of all of them at once.

Custom Hotkeys

This has also been requested for a long time! There is a new page in the Settings to customize your hotkeys, where you can modify existing hotkeys or add new ones.

Demo of Features

Using the new templates system, we’ve set up a live demo at https://www.moo.do/demo/. We will continue adding more helpful details and augmenting it with more boards showing how Moo.do works. If you have any suggestions for adding to it, please let us know or join our beta community.
